title.text: On the prepositions which introduce an adjunct of duration

abstractContent.text: This paper deals with the prepositions which introduce an adjunct of duration, such as the English for and in.
On the basis of both crosslingual and mono-lingual evidence these adjuncts are argued to be ambiguous between a floating and an anchored interpretation.
To capture the distinction informal terms I employ the framework of HEAD-DRIVEN PHRASE STRUCTURE GRAMMAR, enriched with a number of devices which are familiar from DISCOURSE REPRESENTATION THEORY.
The resulting analysis is demonstrated to be relevant for machine translation, natural language generation and natural language understanding.
